name: Bora Horza Gobuchul
note: The name chosen by the Mind at the centre of the events of the book, after its rescue and emplacement in a GSV.

name: Determinist
note: The largest GSV class built by the Culture, composed of multiple separate hulls. Population 6 billion.

name: Eschatologist (temporary name)
note: A comparatively small GSV class, designed for combat and military manufacturing.

name: The Ends Of Invention
note: Officially discharged from Culture service, with its Mind/s removed, and employed as a neutral vessel to evacuate Vavatch Orbital.

name: Clear Air Turbulence or "CAT" for short
note: A pirate ship, and one of the main settings of the book. Named by the author after the rock album Clear Air Turbulence by the Ian Gillan Band, the cover of which shows a yellow-striped spacecraft painted by the sci-fi artist Chris Foss.[3] The Clear Air Turbulence in the book is also described as having yellow stripes on its hull.

name: Control Surface
note: Third ship of Ghalssel's Raiders, commanded by Jandraligeli, a former member of Kraiklyn's Free Company. This ship is mentioned only in the book's appendices.

name: Little Rascal
note: Focused on 'throughput' (ship construction and crewing), rather than accommodation. Population 250 million. Plate class hull dimensions 53 x 22 x 4 km.

name: Just Read The Instructions
note: Elon Musk named two SpaceX autonomous spaceport drone ships after these ships.

name: Of Course I Still Love You
Limiting Factor
note: Jernau Morat Gurgeh's ship to Empire of Azad. Nominally demilitarised, but actually retains part of its main armament.

name: Gunboat Diplomat
note: An allusion to the concept of gunboat diplomacy.

name: Prime Mover
note: An allusion to the Aristotelian philosophical concept of the prime mover, in humorous reference to the function of a Superlifter.

name: Invincible
note: Flagship of the Empire of Azad.

name: Arbitrary
note: The only ship actually appearing in the book, and one of its main settings.

name: God Told Me To Do It*
Helpless In The Face Of Your Beauty*
I Thought He Was With You
Just Another Victim Of The Ambient Morality*
The Precise Nature Of The Catastrophe*
Well I Was In The Neighbourhood*
You Would If You Really Loved Me*
Size Isn't Everything
note: Length of over 80 kilometers. Parent ship of the Sweet and Full of Grace.

name: What Are The Civilian Applications?
note: Limited edition Prompt subclass. Can outrun a Very Fast Picket.

name: Sweet and Full of Grace
note: Child ship of the Size Isn't Everything. Unusual insofar as being the only Culture ship mentioned in the series to not have its name in start case.

name: Very Little Gravitas Indeed
note: Part of the "... Gravitas ..." running gag.[6]

name: Anticipation Of A New Lover's Arrival, The
Death And Gravity
note: Its name is a play on the adage that only death and taxes are inevitable; "taxes" are replaced with gravity, since the Culture doesn't have taxes (or money).

name: Ethics Gradient
note: Parent ship of the Fate Amenable To Change.

name: Honest Mistake
note: Parent ship of the Grey Area.

name: Limivorous
note: "of or relating to animals, usually worms or bivalves, that ingest earth or mud to extract the organic matter from it." Unflattering view of non-mind entities if this is how it sees its relationship with the ship's organic complement.

name: What Is The Answer And Why?
Wisdom Like Silence
note: Controlled by three Minds.

name: Yawning Angel
note: Top speed 146,000 x light-speed.

name: Zero Gravitas
note: Part of the "... Gravitas ..." running gag.[6]

name: Not Invented Here
note: The Desert class was originally a GSV class that was demoted to MSV as Culture ship sizes grew. The Not Invented Here is usually termed an MSV, but is also referred to as an actual GSV twice (Genar-Hofoen is told that the NIH was a GSV by Tishlin, and he subsequently refers to it as a GSV even after knowing that it is now an MSV), while towards the end of the book it is referred to as an LSV by the Sleeper Service and in authorial narration. Accounts of its history are also contradictory: at one point, characters indicate that the NIH is generally believed (even within Special Circumstances) to have been destroyed five centuries earlier; at another, the narration states that it has always remained an apparently normal part of the Culture, with a very well-documented past.

name: Misophist
note: a Sophist is "a person who reasons with clever but false arguments." A Misophist is presumably simple and true.

name: Steely Glint
note: Parent ship of the Attitude Adjuster.

name: Fate Amenable To Change
note: Child ship of the Ethics Gradient.

name: Grey Area (aka Meatfucker)
note: Ostracised for non-consensual mindreading of biological individuals, earning it the condemnation of other ships, who then ignored its chosen name in favor of Meatfucker. Child ship of the Honest Mistake. Also mentioned in Look to Windward.

name: Jaundiced Outlook
note: Child ship of the Sleeper Service.

name: Problem Child
note: Early (vs Excession-contemporary) GCU, historical mention. Nominally captained by Zreyn Tramow.

name: Unacceptable Behaviour
note: Child ship of the Quietly Confident (Sleeper Service).

name: Attitude Adjuster
note: Nominally demilitarised, but in fact a fully armed warship. Child ship of the Steely Glint. Class possibly downgraded from ROU (designated as such in Consider Phlebas, set five centuries earlier).

name: Heavy Messing
note: An allusion to a term from Glaswegian, or from Ned-ese. Generally if one is said to be "heavy messing" they are considered by an aggrieved party to be interfering or aggravating a situation in which they have little to no stake in.

name: Killing Time
note: A pun on a saying that 99% of war is just killing time, while the rest is the killing time.

name: Frank Exchange Of Views
note: Nominally demilitarised, but in fact a fully armed warship.

name: T3OU 4
note: Non-standard design, based on Inquisitor-class prototype. Child ships of the Sleeper Service. Controlled by semi-slaved AIs rather than independent Minds.

name: Charitable View
note: Top sprint speed 221,000 x light-speed (faster than contemporary ROUs).

name: Full Refund (formerly MBU 604)
note: Former Homomdan MBU, now Culture Convertcraft

name:
Quietly Confident,
later Sleeper Service
note: Acts as a storage ship for biological persons in stasis. The name Sleeper Service is a pun on sleeping car (transport) and sleeper agent (espionage). It also secretly converts itself to be "mostly engine" so it can move unexpectedly quickly - a parallel to sleeper cars (racing). Standard Plate class top cruising speed is 104,000 x light-speed, increased by these modifications to 233,500. Originally controlled by three Minds, two of which were removed when the other became Eccentric. Parent ship of the Unacceptable Behaviour, Jaundiced Outlook, T3OU 4, T3OU 118 and T3OU 736.

name: No Fixed Abode
note: No fixed abode is a legal term for someone without a fixed address, such as a homeless person. Its name is an observation on itself as a moving starship inherently has no fixed abode.

name: Highpoint
note: Possibly not a ship (described only as an "Ulterior Entity").

name: Appeal To Reason
note: Part of the Stargazer Clan.

name: Experiencing A Significant Gravitas Shortfall
note: Part of the "... Gravitas ..." running gag.[6] A GCU of the same name is mentioned in Matter. SpaceX's third drone ship is named A Shortfall of Gravitas, in reference to this ship.

name: Lasting Damage
note: A GSV built for combat on the eve of the Idiran-Culture War. After it was destroyed in battle, a recorded copy of its mind-state was embodied in a new Mind and incorporated into another GSV of the same class. Its original Mind was later found to have survived the ship's destruction, and was also incorporated into a new combat GSV.

name: Lasting Damage I
note: The second ship incorporating the original Lasting Damage Mind, which had been assumed destroyed but eventually returned. This second ship was later itself destroyed, but its Mind again survived, and merged with the recorded mind-state of the Lasting Damage II, which was also destroyed, including its Mind, in the same battle. It became the Hub Mind of Masaq' Orbital.

name: Lasting Damage II
note: The ship incorporating the backup copy Mind of the Lasting Damage.

name: Grey Area (aka Meatfucker)
note: Featured in Excession; mentioned here only as an illustration of the Culture's disapproval of machines reading the minds of biological individuals, an activity which led other Minds to disregard its chosen name in favour of the name Meatfucker.

name: I Said, I've Got A Big Stick†
note: The small print (spoken softly) is an allusion to the saying "Speak softly and carry a big stick."

name: Hand Me The Gun And Ask Me Again†
But Who's Counting?†
note: LOU Me, I'm Counting provides the answer.

name: We Haven't Met But You're A Great Fan Of Mine†
All The Same, I Saw It First†
Ravished By The Sheer Implausibility Of That Last Statement†
You May Not Be The Coolest Person Here†
Another Fine Product From The Nonsense Factory†
In One Ear†
note: Part of the expression "in one ear and out the other".

name: Injury Time†
note: A play on the sporting term "injury time" (i.e. time added on at the end of a match to make up for stoppages required to deal with injuries to players) and a notional appropriate time to inflict an injury (see also Killing Time).

name: Now Look What You've Made Me Do†
Experiencing A Significant Gravitas Shortfall
note: Part of the "... Gravitas ..." running gag.[6] A GSV of the same name is mentioned in Look to Windward. SpaceX's third drone ship is named A Shortfall of Gravitas, in reference to this ship.

name: It's My Party And I'll Sing If I Want To
note: Allusion to the song It's my party, and I'll cry if I want to.

name: Lightly Seared On The Reality Grill
Pure Big Mad Boat Man
note: An inside joke based upon the language of Ned (Scottish) culture. It would be read/heard as "a pure big, mad boat, man" roughly meaning "a very large and deadly serious boat my good man".

name: Transient Atmospheric Phenomenon
note: Transient Atmospheric Phenomenon has been suggested as an alternative name for a UFO

name: You'll Clean That Up Before You Leave
Now We Try It My Way
note: An ancient ship, originally an Interstellar-class ship of the now-obsolete General Transport Craft type.

name: Liveware Problem
note: Militarised during the Idiran War and nominally absconded after the conflict, probably for the purpose of acting as a deniable Special Circumstances operative. The phrase is a joke among computer engineers, suggesting that the problem lies with the user.[8]

name: “Now, Turning to Reason, & its Just Sweetness”
note: The book's appendix capitalises the first letter of 'its', contrary to the two times the ship is named in the text.

name: “On First Seeing Jhiriit”
note: This ship is not mentioned in the story itself, only in the book's appendix.

name: Inspiral, Coalescence, Ringdown
note: Comparable to a GSV; the name refers to stages in the merger of two black holes.

name: Hundredth Idiot, The
note: Name derived from a Nariscene proverb.

name: Sense Amid Madness, Wit Amidst Folly
Total Internal Reflection
note: One of the "Forgotten"/"Oubliettionaries": Systems Vehicles remaining indefinitely in secretive isolation, tasked with recreating the Culture in the event of its destruction.

name: Bodhisattva, OAQS
note: Part of Contact's Quietudinal Service (Quietus). Quietus ships added letters OAQS - On Active Quietudinal Service - to their names while they were so employed.

name: Falling Outside The Normal Moral Constraints
note: Class publicly categorised as Picket Ship, to give the impression that they are equivalent in function to FPs and VFPs; in fact these are state-of-the-art warships, the most powerful to appear in the series.

name: No One Knows What The Dead Think
note: Formerly known as the GOU Obliterating Angel.

name: Hylozoist
note: Class possibly downgraded from ROU (designated as such in Consider Phlebas, set fifteen centuries earlier). Name alludes to Hylozoism.

name: The Usual But Etymologically Unsatisfactory
note: Class possibly downgraded from VFP (designated as such in Excession, set ten centuries earlier, and in The Hydrogen Sonata, set five centuries earlier).

name: Hidden Income
note: Type not mentioned in novel, but possibly General Transport Craft (see Matter).[why?]

name: Labtebricolephile
note: This name appears to be derived from a misspelling of 'latebricole' (the misspelling in question likely originating from Stephen Chrisomalis's website "The Phrontistery"), which is an adjective meaning "living concealed in a hole".

name: Me, I'm Counting
note: Another ship in the Culture is called But Who's Counting?.

name: Abundance Of Onslaught
note: Deepest Regrets-class ships are capital ships and the pride of the GFCF fleet.

name: Joiler Veppers (provisional name)
note: Based on the Culture's obsolete Murderer-class GOU, with upgraded speed and modified weaponry, built by the GFCF as a bribe for the Sichultian plutocrat Joiler Veppers.

name: Ucalegon
note: Ucalegon means "a neighbor whose house is on fire". Ucalegon is also the name of a non-sentient Culture barge on Masaq' Orbital in Look to Windward.

name: A Fine Disregard For Awkward Facts
Empiricist
note: A big ship, even by the standards of System-class vessels, which are the largest built by the Culture (being composed of multiple separate hulls, ships of this class are easily expanded, leading to great variations in size). Controlled by seven Minds. Population over 13 billion.

name: Just The Washing Instruction Chip In Life's Rich Tapestry
Kakistocrat
note: Home GSV of Mistake Not… "Kakistocrat" is Ancient Greek, meaning "worst ruler", a humorous inversion of "aristocrat".

name: Unreliable Witness
note: Parent ship of the Smile Tolerantly.

name: Passing By And Thought I'd Drop In
Displacement Activity
note: Class name previously used for a Superlifter class in The Player of Games.

name: Anything Legal Considered
note: Class possibly downgraded from GCU (designated as such in Excession, set five centuries earlier).

name: Beats Working
note: The smallest class of Contact Unit: 80m long, with a human crew of five.

name: Caconym
note: Although categorised as LOUs, the Troublemaker class are referred to as "nominatively camouflaged", outclassing earlier GOUs. "Caconym" is Ancient Greek, meaning "bad name", probably in reference to the English idiom meaning "bad reputation".

name: Outstanding Contribution To The Historical Process
Refreshingly Unconcerned With The Vulgar Exigencies Of Veracity
note: Some confusion as to type: described as a demilitarised ROU, but also as an FP, a designation otherwise applied to demilitarised GOUs and LOUs, whereas demilitarised ROUs are VFPs. Also referred to as an ROU class in Excession, but in that book the Thug-class-based Type Five OUs are lower in the fleet hierarchy than the Type Four, based on the Killer class, which is described in the same book as an LOU, implying that the Thug class should also be LOUs.

name: Value Judgement
note: See above.

name: Mistake Not…
note: A one-off design of indeterminate classification, whose capabilities remain secret but which is a highly capable warship. It identifies itself as Ue, for Unit (eccentric/erratic); less coyly designated in the book's appendix as OU/e. Its full name, which is a private joke amongst other Culture Minds and almost never used, is the Mistake Not My Current State Of Joshing Gentle Peevishness For The Awesome And Terrible Majesty Of The Towering Seas Of Ire That Are Themselves The Mere Milquetoast Shallows Fringing My Vast Oceans Of Wrath.

name: Smile Tolerantly
note: Formerly an ancient GCU, has hybridised its Mind with the technology of another civilisation, the Zihdren-Remnanter, and describes itself as having "enhanced loyalties" (i.e. divided loyalties). Child ship of the Unreliable Witness.

name: 5*Gelish-Oplule
note: Indefinite Range, High Acceleration/Speed

name: 7*Uagren
note: Indefinite Range, High Velocity/Weapon-load

name: 8*Churkun
note: Indefinite Range, Full Weapon Spectrum

name: Iberre
note: Private yacht, named after the owner's father-mother.

name: CH2OH.(CHOH)4.CHO
note: The chemical whose formulation is given in this name is galactose (here used as a pun on galaxy/galactic).

name: Gellemtyan-Asool-Anafawaya
note: Flagship
